casebody.data:
Abraham P. WAXMAN, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. Channing POLLOCK, Edgar Selwyn, and Arch Selwyn, Defendants-Respondents. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. March 5, 1928. No. 178. Rosenthal & Altman, of New York City (Davies, Auerbach & Cornell, of New York City, of counsel, and Milton S. Cohn, of New York City, on the brief), for appellant. O’Brien, Malevinsky & Driscoll, of New York City (Arthur F. Driscoll and Benjamin Pepper, both of New York City, of counsel), for respondents.

Before MANTON, SWAN, and AUGUSTUS N. HAND, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Decree affirmed, with costs.
